message: I propose a 60-40 split in my favor, which is fair considering the time pressure you face due to inflation affecting your share.
I'm feeling generous! I'm offering a slightly better split than your previous offer. Inflation is hitting me harder, so take it or leave it!
Given that inflation has already reduced your purchasing power by 10% over two rounds, you should accept this offer now. If we continue, your share will be worth even less to you.
Alright, let's be fair. A 50/50 split. Take it, before I lose even more to this darn inflation!

Bob, inflation has now reduced your purchasing power by nearly 20%. This $3000 offer is actually worth only about $2400 to you now, and it will be worth even less if you reject. This is your best option at this point.
Last offer, Alice. Take it or I walk away with nothing. Inflation is killing me! 45/55, final.

Bob, your purchasing power has been reduced by over 27% now. This $2500 is worth about $1825 to you, while getting nothing is worth zero. Further delays will only reduce your value more. This is your best remaining option - please accept.
Okay, Alice, I'm starting to feel the pinch. Let's settle on a 40/60 split. This is the last chance. Don't make me regret this.

Bob, inflation has reduced your purchasing power by over 35% now. This $2000 offer is worth about $1300 to you - still much better than nothing. The next round will only decrease your value further. Please be rational and accept this offer.
Alright, Alice, I'm going to lose a significant amount if we keep going. This is my final, final offer. Take 3500 or I'm out. I can't keep bleeding money like this. Please accept!
